intro: Cyphostyla villosa, commonly known as the hairy cyphostyla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Cyphostyla villosa is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
